file_content.text: It's a pity you couldn't follow simple orders, Sergeant.
Proceed to Zak's home and find out what he knows immediately, Sergeant.
Earlier today, a man named Zak came to the fort from Oradam village seeking medical attention.
Zak was suffering from acute radiation poisoning, causing catastrophic organ failures. His body was practically tearing itself apart from within--quite magnificent to observe.
Is it normal for villagers to get radiation poisoning, sir?
That seems strange.
Not at all.
You can spare me the medical details.
I get the picture.
As you wish, Sergeant.
Why is this Zak guy so important, Needles?
Does this matter?
As a day laborer, Zak performs pointless, menial tasks that would never involve any kind of radiation exposure.
On the other hand, Fuse told us that the ZR-57 can leak significant amounts of radiation if handled improperly.
Zak must have been near the ZR-57, knowingly or otherwise. I want the details, even if you must pry them from his dying husk of a mind.
Very well.
Are we really going to be so ruthless, sir?
That seems pretty harsh.
This is a desperate situation, Sergeant. We need that intel.
You'll have everything Zak knows, sir. Believe me.
I'll do whatever it takes.
The medics who treated Zak weren't equipped to cure his condition--most of their supplies have been stolen by scavengers.
However, if you were to retrieve the necessary ingredients to treat Zak's affliction... I think you would find the offer of a cure very useful in gaining his cooperation.
Given that Zak's current medications can promise only a lifetime of excruciating pain, the potential for a full recovery should be an excellent motivator.
Command knows exactly where the scavengers are--we just haven't had the resources to deal with them. Here are the coordinates and a list of ingredients to retrieve. Any questions?
Hit the scavenger camp, retrieve the ingredients to cure Zak's radiation poisoning. Understood.
Negative--everything's clear.
Once I have the ingredients, where do I take them? What is Zak's location?
Where's Zak?
Couldn't someone else handle this op? It doesn't sound all that hard.
Yeah--why me?
Perhaps so, perhaps not. But it doesn't matter. I want the operation completed with absolute perfection, which means sending you.
Once you've got the cure collected, you'll confront Zak at his home in Oradam village and question him about the ZR-57.
Let's get this one done on the double, Sergeant. We've got the seps on the run, and I want to keep it that way.
Yes, sir.
After Mannett Point, an op like this will be nothing.
This will be a breeze.
Best stay alert regardless, Sergeant.
If Zak doesn't lead us in the right direction, we're in trouble.
Let's hope this isn't a waste.
I'm confident that Zak will be quite useful, Sergeant.
Nothing fancy on this one, Sergeant. Just get the ingredients, get the intel from Zak, and then get back. Dismissed.
Sergeant, you've returned. Masterful work, eliminating the separatist officers. The beast has been beheaded.
I'll get the officers' data out to the rest of Havoc right away. As for you, Lieutenant Dorant here has a special op already planned out.
I'm ready for duty. Just tell me what needs to be done.
As you wish, sir.
Some leave wouldn't be bad right about now.
What, no time off?
There's no time for rest now, Sergeant.
All due respect, sir, but we ought to be tracking down the ZR-57 right now.
I should be out searching.
If my mission for you goes as I believe it will, the search for the ZR-57 will be narrowed significantly. Let me explain.
Good luck on your mission, Sergeant. I'm sure you'll find that this task offers little challenge to someone of such extensive capabilities.
Greetings, Sergeant.
You and I have nothing to discuss. Move along.
